Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli

Class Cli

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable<java.lang.Object>
it.polimi.ingsw.view.View
it.polimi.ingsw.view.cli.Cli
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<Update>
public class Cli
extends View
implements Observer<Update>
Cli is the class in which interactions with users are managed. This class extends Observable interface and different types of command observe it.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cli

      public Cli​(Client client, Controller controller)
      Cli is the builder of the class. At the moment of the Cli creation a client and a controller of the client are associated to it. A new instance of CliUpdateHandler is created which manages all the updates notified by server.
      Parameters:
      client - indicates the client with whom a conversation with the Cli instance created will take place.
      controller - indicates clientSideController implements client-side checks in order to avoid repeated and unnecessary interactions with the server.

  • Method Details

    • convertColorToAnsi

      public static java.lang.String convertColorToAnsi​(PrintableColor color)
      This method converts a color given as parameter according to enum defined, and it is used to have the correct correspondence Ansi color.
      Parameters:
      color - is the PrintableColor you want to calculate the Ansi code
      Returns:
      the string of the respective Ansi color.

    • toBold

      public static java.lang.String toBold​(java.lang.String s)
      This method is used to make a string given as parameter in bold
      Parameters:
      s - is the string that you want in bold
      Returns:
      the bold String

    • println

      public void println​(java.lang.String string)
      This is a method useful to avoid code repetitions It is an abbreviation of stdout.println
      Parameters:
      string - id the string printed by this method.

    • newLine

      public void newLine()
      This is a method useful to avoid code repetitions. It simply prints a blank line

    • start

      public void start()
      In this method, once a connection between client and server is established, every game phase is managed.
      Specified by:
      start in class View

    • getInitialGodChooser

      public boolean getInitialGodChooser()
      This method is a simple getter to have access to the private instance of the boolean attribute isInitialGodChooser of this class.
      Returns:
      true if isInitialGodChooser is true value set, otherwise it returns false.

    • setInitialGodChooser

      void setInitialGodChooser​(boolean value)
      This method is a setter used to set to the received value of the parameter if this client is or not the GodChooser.
      Parameters:
      value - is received as boolean parameter from the server, after having it randomly from the players list.

    • getSelectableGods

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectableGods()
      This is a method used to have a List that contains all the Gods a player can choose after GodChooser player selected them.
      Returns:
      a List with Gods references which are selectable from a single player, during CHOOSE_GODS game phase.

    • setSelectableGods

      public void setSelectableGods​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectableGods)
      This method make possible client who are not GodChooser to select a God once the GodChooser selected Gods that will be involved in the match.
      Specified by:
      setSelectableGods in class View
      Parameters:
      selectableGods - is as list used to have references to all Gods a player can choose in a specific match (once GodChooser selected them)

    • getSelectedNicknames

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectedNicknames()
      This method is used to have a list that contains all the nicknames already chosen from different Players in a match. It is used in the first phase of a match, during INITIAL_INFO game phase, to avoid the possibility that different players involved in a match choose the same nicknames.
      Returns:
      a List with all the names already chosen from other players for a single match.

    • setSelectedNicknames

      public void setSelectedNicknames​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> selectedNicknames)
      This method let clients choose a nickname unique in the match.
      Specified by:
      setSelectedNicknames in class View
      Parameters:
      selectedNicknames - is a list of all nickname already chosen from players.

    • getSelectableColors

      public java.util.List<PrintableColor> getSelectableColors()
      This method is used to have a list that contains all the colors already chosen from different Players in a match. It is used in the first phase of a match, during INITIAL_INFO game phase, to avoid the possibility that different players involved in a match choose the same color.
      Returns:
      a List with all the colors already chosen from other players for a single match.

    • setSelectableColors

      public void setSelectableColors​(java.util.List<PrintableColor> selectableColors)
      This method let clients choose a color unique in the match.
      Specified by:
      setSelectableColors in class View
      Parameters:
      selectableColors - is a list of all color not yet chosen from players.

    • setCurrentGamePhase

      public void setCurrentGamePhase​(GamePhase newGamePhase)
      This setter method is used to set a specific game phase. It is necessary to have this method to change different phase during the match.
      Overrides:
      setCurrentGamePhase in class View
      Parameters:
      newGamePhase - is the new phase that it is set with the invocation of this method.

    • update

      public void update​(Update update)
      This method manages all the message received from the server. Visitor pattern used to invoke the correct method for each different instance of update from server to client.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<Update>
      Parameters:
      update - contains references to what changes server-side and it is notified to the client.

    • printPlayerGods

      public void printPlayerGods()
      This method is used to print Gods chosen by users. Its format is [nickname] has [God Name] and it is printed for each player involved in the match

    • printPlayersColors

      void printPlayersColors()
      This method is used to print colors chosen by users. Its format is [nickname] is [color] and it is printed for each player involved in the match

    • playerWithColor

      public java.lang.String playerWithColor​(java.lang.String nickname)
      This method is used to print a specific nickname of a player involved in a match with the same color the player choose during the INITIAL_INFO game phase.
      Parameters:
      nickname - is a String which contains the nickname of a player involved in the match.
      Returns:
      a colored String. Colored with color chosen from the player with the nickname given as parameter.

    • printCurrentTurn

      public void printCurrentTurn()
      This method is simply used as delegator. It is invoked from CliUpdateHandler when a match starts, a player's turn ends or when a player asks whose turn is it. It invokes otherInfoHandler.printCurrentTurn in which all the prints are defined.

    • printGamePreparationInfo

      public void printGamePreparationInfo()
      This method is used to print during GAME_PREPARATION game phase a particular string which invites Players to place them workers on the board.

    • wantsToContinueToWatch

      boolean wantsToContinueToWatch()
      This method is a simply getter. Once the player associated to the Cli lose, this method gives information if the wants to continue watch the match in which he was involved.
      Returns:
      true if the player response to the question "Do you want to continue to watch this match?" was positive, false otherwise.

    • setContinueToWatch

      public void setContinueToWatch​(boolean continueToWatch)
      This method set continueToWatch attribute to the boolean value given as parameter. It indicates if a player which is involved in a match, after losing the match wants to watch other players play
      Parameters:
      continueToWatch - is a boolean value that indicates if the player wants continue to watch

    • getCurrentBoard

      public java.lang.String getCurrentBoard()
      This method is used to have the JSON representation of the current Board.
      Returns:
      the String JSON-format of the board

    • setCurrentBoard

      public void setCurrentBoard​(java.lang.String board)
      This method is a simple setter of the String attribute currentBoard to the
      Parameters:
      board - given in JSON representation.

    • getCurrentPhaseString

      public java.lang.String getCurrentPhaseString()
      This method is a String getter which
      Returns:
      a particular string useful in many prints

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard​(java.lang.String board)
      This method prints the board. It is used when a player moves one of his workers, or build a level. It is also used when a player requests "BOARD" command.
      Parameters:
      board - is the JSON-format of the board to be printed.

    • getStdin

      public java.util.Scanner getStdin()
      This method makes available what is received as input from console.
      Returns:
      the Scanner stdin attribute in order to have access to monitor what Cli receives as input in console.
